listings.Program Name: Bachelor of Arts in Mass Communication
listings.Program Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Mass Communication (BAMC) aims to prepare a new generation of communicators who combine talent and technical digital knowledge to create and manage content relevant to corporate and non-profit sectors. The program’s focal areas in digital storytelling, multiplatform communications, multimedia journalism, social media, infographics and social analytics seek to engage students with the latest media industry trends through both on-campus and field learning and training.

Students who select the Integrated Marketing Communications (IMC) concentration must successfully complete a minimum of 30 credits with a focus on principles of integrated marketing, multiplatform media planning and social media strategies.
Students who select the journalism concentration must complete a minimum of 30 credits, including courses on principles of journalism, news writing, digital storytelling, and multimedia journalism.
The minor consists of a minimum of 18 credits, including at least nine credits in courses at or above the 300 level, and is not open to mass communication students in the IMC concentration.
